job_title: - Software Engineer (m/w/d) – systemnahe Entwicklung, Linux Guru
job_description:
WEN WIR SUCHEN:



 * Du verfügst über eine erfolgreich abgeschlossene IT-Ausbildung (Studium oder Fachinformatiker) oder mehrjährige Erfahrungen als Systemadministrator (mind. 5 Jahre)
 * Du verfügst über tiefgreifende Linux-Kenntnisse
 * Du hast Interesse an Technologien wie Golang, Docker-Containerisierung oder APT-Paketen
 * Du hast Spaß, neue Technologien und Themengebiete kennenzulernen
 * Du bist zielorientiert, motiviert und engagiert in allen Deinen Aufgaben
 * Du möchtest in Deinen Projekten eigene Ideen einbringen und so neue Lösungen entwickeln
 * Auf Deutsch kannst Du ebenso überzeugend kommunizieren wie auf Englisch



WAS WIR BIETEN:



 * Einen interessanter Aufgabenbereich: Betreuung des modernsten Einkaufswagen der Welt
 * Spannendes, zukunftsweisendes und innovatives Arbeitsumfeld
 * Ein dynamisches, internationales und gut gelauntes Team
 * Ein Arbeitsplatz, der in den letzten Jahren immer wieder als Great Place To Work® ausgezeichnet wurde
 * Immer offene Türen für Dich und Deine Ideen - bis zur Verwirklichung!
 * Das beste IT-Equipment - wähle aus womit Du am besten arbeiten kannst
 * Individuelles Weiterbildungsprogramm zur Unterstützung Deiner persönlichen Entwicklungsziele
 * Team Events, die wirklich Spaß machen



WAS UNSERE MITARBEITER ÜBER UNS SAGEN:



 * "Coole Leute, offene Mentalität, super Stimmung, lustige Events und arbeiten macht auch Spass"
 * "Tolle Kollegen, tolles Klima und viel Freiraum für Ideen"
 * “Neue Dinge lernen, herausfordernde Aufgaben, Freiraum etwas zu verändern“
 * "Arbeiten mit Arbeitskollegen wie mit Freunden ist toll“
 * "Sinn für Humor und coole Aufgaben"
 * “Wertschätzung für geleistete Arbeit”
 * "Hier kann man selbständig arbeiten und eigene Ideen einbringen"



ÜBER UNS

Bei Pentland Firth sind wir ein Team. Der Mensch, egal ob Mitarbeiter oder Kunde, steht bei uns im Mittelpunkt. Als IT Unternehmen, das 2004 gegründet wurde, kreieren wir unsere Lösungen mit und für die Menschen, die sie nutzen. Ebenso prägend für unsere einzigartige internationale Unternehmenskultur ist der kreative Geist unserer Mitarbeiter, der uns von der klassischen IT-Beratung zu einem Vorreiter in der Technologie gebracht hat.

job_title: Middle level Golang Engineer (m/f/d) - Content Platform team
job_description:
The Content Platform team is looking for a motivated and driven Golang engineer who will help us shape our team, drive the company to the next level, and have the most direct influence on our success.

The team works closely with eCommerce, Marketing, and Customer Service to provide ideal entry points into Flix’s customer-facing web properties. We develop the business's homepage, Content Management System (CMS), demand-driven search engine landing pages, and an interactive map that allows users to explore Flix’s destinations.

Working with us means you’ll be building the very first touchpoint most customers have with Flix, be it a direct visit to the homepage or a city-related landing page reached through a Google search. Your releases will be viewed and interacted with by a very large audience.

You’ll be joining an open-minded and easy-going team that currently consists of 4 Software Engineers and a UI/UX Expert. Our tech stack mainly consists of:

 * Backend: Go, ArangoDB, MySQL, Confluent Kafka, Snowflake, GraphQL + different AWS services
 * Frontend: server-side rendered HTML + JavaScript, Typescript, React

Your Tasks – Paint the world green

 * As part of the cross-functional, self-organised team, you work iteratively on implementing sustainable solutions that deliver business value and are backed by a well-designed implementation that is easy to change, self-documenting, and well-tested.
 * You are responsible for developing, building, and maintaining our Homepage, Automated Landing Pages, and Exploration Map for all Flix markets.
 * A strong team player with expertise in Agile methodologies, valuing close collaboration, shared responsibilities, and iterative development.
 * As part of your daily work, you work closely with your fellow team members, for example in pair and mob programming, doing code reviews and testing.
 * You analyse, propose, and drive technology improvements.
 * You proactively seek to learn new technologies and gain a deeper insight into the business domain.
 * You enjoy sharing your expertise and helping both within your team and outside of it.
 * You support our agile, flexible, team-oriented development.

Your Profile – Ready to hop on board

 * At least 4 years of hands-on software engineering experience, including a solid practical experience using Go
 * Skills in building high-performant, scalable, and reliable large-scale applications
 * Experience working with different types of databases (relational, NoSQL)
 * Knowledge of distributed architecture and API design (GraphQL, REST API)
 * Experience working with Docker and Kubernetes
 * Experience in CI/CD
 * Familiar with cloud technologies, including AWS
 * Experience in unit & integration testing

Nice to have

 * IaC (Terraform)
 * Experience working with Kafka
 * Some experience with PHP and JavaScript

Our Perks – More than just a job

 * You have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are creating the easiest way to travel. We want your ideas and give you autonomy to make them reality.
 * Flix is flexible. Organize your own schedule with trust-based hours and up to 60 days of working from (m)anywhere. We are an office-first company, and we encourage all employees to come regularly to their local office.
 * Travelling is our passion. Discover the world with your free Flix rides and bring along your friends and family for half price.
 * Teamwork makes the dream work. Our FlixTeam has people from over 80 different nations. We work in a multicultural environment where we can challenge and support each other.
 * We're not only green in color. We’re building for the long term, and that means protecting our planet. We constantly test new green technologies and compensate for the CO2 after all our business travel since 2018.
 * Your well-being is important to us. To treat your mind and body we will give you a competitive paid time off package, mental health support including 1:1 consultations with a psychologist, and a neat discount on UrbanSportsClub memberships.

Want to rewrite the history of mobility with us? Then join our ride and apply now. We're excited to hear from you! We recognize that everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences. If you think you could have an impact even though you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply.



Flix – A place to enjoy work and have an impact

The future of transportation is Green. Here at Flix Tech, the R&D group, we develop software with the brightest minds from around the world to engineer new experiences for our millions of customers across our apps and websites. Every day we solve challenging problems, like how to scale rapidly around the world and how to make an experience that delights our customers. We have a culture of sharing ideas, contributing to open source projects and being an active member in our technical communities.

Flix is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy and gender identity), national, social or ethnic origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, competence and merit.

Homeoffice wird im Moment sehr großzügig angeboten. Teilweise dürfen sogar Monitore, Stühle oder ähnliches mit nach Hause genommen werden.
Very flexible working, office and homeoffice

employerBenefitSummary.comment:
Let's make our journey together the best it can possibly be. With benefits that not only make you enjoy life (and work) more but treat your mind and body well.

  • Flexible working hours and up to 60 days of working from (m)anywhere.
  • Free personal rides for employees + 50% friends and family discount
  • International teams with more than 90 nationalities
  • Well-being offers (1:1 counselling with OpenUp, + gym memberships)
  • Language learning support with Babbel and Learnlight
  • Sustainable company, compensating for all business travel related CO2

managedContent.body:
What a journey!

When they founded Flix in 2013, entrepreneurs Jochen Engert, André Schwämmlein and Daniel Krauss planned to make bus travel sustainable, comfortable and affordable. FlixBus started with buses on the German road and quickly became market leader across Europe, developing into the largest range of long-distance buses on the continent. Flix is now operating in over 40 countries as well as the USA and South America. There is an international team of over 3,000 employees working from over 20 locations with headquarters in Munich and Berlin.
managedContent.title: Flix's Story

managedContent.body:
Painting the world green


Our vision is to make it possible for everyone to discover the world to enjoy smart, sustainable travel. Ease of booking and an ever-growing offering mean that we provide millions of travelers with a comfortable, affordable, eco-friendly travel experience. Our green long-distance buses and long-distance trains meet the highest standards of comfort, safety and environmental protection, and offer a green alternative to private transport.
managedContent.title: Our vision

managedContent.body:
We move limits – on maps and in minds
Flix isn’t just any company. We move limits constantly, because we believe that what we do matters to millions of people. The way we do it is equally important – and this includes the behaviors and mindsets that we value in ourselves and in each other.

Our team in numbers


When you're working at Flix you're working with the whole world. Not literally of course, at least not yet. Nevertheless, we grew from just a few people in a tiny office to a FlixTeam of thousands of people. And the more we grow, the more international we become, because we love to work across locations and nationalities so we can meet and get to know diverse cultures and viewpoints. Just like travelling...
managedContent.title: Working at Flix

managedContent.body:
We have developed our values, the Flix4, together, listening to employees and leaders alike, to make sure we are creating a culture where everyone can thrive and be included. The Flix 4, as we call it, summarize what working at Flix is all about – clustered in four different dimensions.

We build for generations
Every day, because we want to impact our communities and the greater world with building a sustainable future.

We push boundaries
and chase new ideas since day one.

We win together
when we work together, as teams.

I make an impact
underlines how each of us at Flix can make us a high-impact organization.
managedContent.title: Values - Our Flix4

job.jobTitleText: Middle level Golang Engineer (m/f/d) - Content Platform team

ceo.name: André Schwämmlein, Daniel Krauss, Jochen Engert

job_description:
INTRODUCTION SENTENCE

Become part of the Verivox team!

We are looking for you! We offer a full-time position (40h/week) as a Senior Engineer Frontend (m/f/d) in one of our locations in either Heidelberg, Berlin, Leipzig or Munich. The offer includes the option of working several days per week in the mobile office .


YOUR MISSION

 * You are not afraid to ask for help and have a growth mindset.
 * Through your expertise, you provide excellent user experience to our web application.
 * You are part of a cross-functional team and in close cooperation with UX Designer, Backend engineers, QA engineers and Product Owner in an established Agile environment.
 * Suggest improvements, ideas, and solutions and offer help.
 * Bring your opinion to the table and be the present voice during product and technical discussions.


YOUR ESSENTIAL EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION

 * You have many years of experience building software and strive for a good user experience combined with good code quality.
 * Extensive hands-on experience with modern frontend technologies, especially Angular 17/18
 * Proficient in HTML5 and SCSS
 * Familiarity with AngularJS is a significant plus.
 * Skilled in unit testing using Jest, Jasmine, or Karma
 * You possess a DevOps mindset and thus CI/CD workflows using Git is a given.
 * You are familiar with agile methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban
 * You have experience with collaboration tools like ClickUp, Jira, or Confluence
 * You have excellent English oral and written communication skills.


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

 * Around 500 employees from over 35 nations as a collegial community
 * Open and diverse corporate culture with flat hierarchies, as well as a modern and appreciative working environment
 * Generous Mobile office regulations enabling flexible work from home and within the EU
 * Individual area of responsibility with space for the development of one's own ideas and concepts
 * Uncomplicated cooperation: we are on first-name terms & don't insist on dress codes
 * Exclusive employee benefits such as a job ticket, job bike, lunch subsidies via Sodexo, and employee discounts
 * Company health management, including company pension schemes, Urban Sports Club, Crossfit, and Mental Health Days
 * Centrally located offices in Heidelberg, Berlin, Munich, and Leipzig with optimal transportation connections


CLOSURE

Are you up to meet these exciting challenges?

If so, then we would love to talk to you. Tell us how you will contribute to our success story! Please send your application (including your salary expectation and the earliest possible date of starting to work) via “Apply now” or to jobs@verivox.com .

Verivox is one of the leading online comparison portals in Germany. Since 1998, we have been making markets transparent in the areas of electricity & gas, mobile phones & internet and finance & insurance. We find the best offer for consumers from around 30,000 tariffs, helping households to save time and money. With our help more than 8 million customers have already saved over 2 billion euros. job_description_html:
Introduction Sentence

Become part of the Verivox team!

We are looking for you! We offer a full-time position (40h/week) as a Senior Engineer Frontend (m/f/d) in one of our locations in either Heidelberg, Berlin, Leipzig or Munich. The offer includes the option of working several days per week in the mobile office .

Your Mission

  • You are not afraid to ask for help and have a growth mindset.
  • Through your expertise, you provide excellent user experience to our web application.
  • You are part of a cross-functional team and in close cooperation with UX Designer, Backend engineers, QA engineers and Product Owner in an established Agile environment.
  • Suggest improvements, ideas, and solutions and offer help.
  • Bring your opinion to the table and be the present voice during product and technical discussions.

Your essential experience and education

  • You have many years of experience building software and strive for a good user experience combined with good code quality.
  • Extensive hands-on experience with modern frontend technologies, especially Angular 17/18
  • Proficient in HTML5 and SCSS
  • Familiarity with AngularJS is a significant plus.
  • Skilled in unit testing using Jest, Jasmine, or Karma
  • You possess a DevOps mindset and thus CI/CD workflows using Git is a given.
  • You are familiar with agile methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban
  • You have experience with collaboration tools like ClickUp, Jira, or Confluence
  • You have excellent English oral and written communication skills.

What's in it for you?

  • Around 500 employees from over 35 nations as a collegial community
  • Open and diverse corporate culture with flat hierarchies, as well as a modern and appreciative working environment
  • Generous Mobile office regulations enabling flexible work from home and within the EU
  • Individual area of responsibility with space for the development of one's own ideas and concepts
  • Uncomplicated cooperation: we are on first-name terms & don't insist on dress codes
  • Exclusive employee benefits such as a job ticket, job bike, lunch subsidies via Sodexo, and employee discounts
  • Company health management, including company pension schemes, Urban Sports Club, Crossfit, and Mental Health Days
  • Centrally located offices in Heidelberg, Berlin, Munich, and Leipzig with optimal transportation connections

Closure

Are you up to meet these exciting challenges?

If so, then we would love to talk to you. Tell us how you will contribute to our success story! Please send your application (including your salary expectation and the earliest possible date of starting to work) via “Apply now” or to jobs@verivox.com .

job_description:
WILLKOMMEN BEI JUNIQE

Dare to be JUNIQE! Wir haben es uns zur Aufgabe gemacht, eine Spielwiese für die Gestaltung und Realisierung eigener Ideen zu kreieren, auf der sich jede\*r ausprobieren und austoben kann. Das Ziel? Den Markt einzigartiger Print on Demand Produkte zu revolutionieren und der Kreativität von Creatorn und Kund\*innen durch Personalisierung keine Grenzen zu setzen. Unser neuer zweiseitiger Marktplatz macht es interessierten Creatorn spielend einfach neue Designs zu entwickeln und diese auf unzählige Produktkategorien drucken zu lassen. Kund\*innen haben die Möglichkeit, jedes Design individuell zu personalisieren und somit zu ihrem zu machen. Wir suchen Mitarbeiter\*innen, die Lust auf Transformation und große Herausforderungen haben.

Bereit, an Bord zu kommen? Wir suchen für unser Büro im Herzen von München in Voll-/ oder Teilzeit einen Backend Engineer (m/w/d).

DEINE CHALLENGE

Als Backend Entwickler bei JUNIQE arbeitest Du an der technischen Basis unserer innovativen Produkte und Lösungen. Deine Leidenschaft ist es, komplexe Herausforderungen zu meistern und kreative Ideen in die Tat umzusetzen? Dann ist das Deine neue Rolle!

Wir haben viele spannende Projekte in der Pipeline und wollen diese gemeinsam mit Deiner Unterstützung umsetzen!

Dein Verantwortungsbereich umfasst:

 * Backend Entwicklung: Du konzipierst innovative Lösungen und entwickelst neue Features auf Basis des Symfony Frameworks in agilen, crossfunktionalen Teams.
 * Automatisierung: Du trägst dazu bei, Arbeitsabläufe stetig zu automatisieren und zu optimieren, um unsere Prozesse noch effizienter zu gestalten.
 * API Entwicklung: Du gewährleistest eine reibungslose Kommunikation zwischen verschiedenen Systemen durch die Entwicklung und Anbindung von Schnittstellen (APIs).
 * Shop: Du wirkst aktiv an der kontinuierlichen Verbesserung unseres selbst entwickelten Shops mit.

Unser Stack:

 * Symfony Framework, Doctrine, PHP8, Composer, RabbitMQ, Redis
 * Tools: k6, DevSpace, Captain Hook
 * Tests: PHPUnit, Codeception
 * Hosting: Kubernetes-Cluster auf AWS
 * Logging und Monitoring: Datadog
 * Continuous-Integration: GitHub
 * Versionierung: GitHub
 * Dokumentation: Confluence
 * Ticketing: Jira

DEIN PROFIL


 * Du hast Deine Ausbildung oder Dein Studium in Informatik o.ä. erfolgreich abgeschlossen
 * Gute Kenntnisse in der Backend Entwicklung mit PHP und Erfahrung mit Frameworks wie Symfony oder Laravel
 * Mindestens 2 Jahre Erfahrung als Backend Entwickler
 * Leidenschaft für Clean Coding und nachhaltige Architektur
 * Kreativität und die Fähigkeit, eigene Ideen einzubringen und über den Tellerrand hinaus zu blicken
 * Du sprichst fließend Deutsch (min. B2-Niveau)

ARBEITE MIT JUNIQE

Von Tech-Support bis People-Power: Wir bei JUNIQE glauben, dass Kreativität und Mut der Motor echter Veränderung sind. Die Zusammenarbeit mit uns ist die Chance, Deine Ideen wahrhaftig umzusetzen. Bei uns machst Du den Unterschied. Du bekommst Verantwortung - wenn Du willst.

Unser internationales Team von Experten und Fachleuten gibt jeden Tag alles, um erstklassige Erlebnisse für unsere Kund: innen und Creator zu erschaffen. Englisch ist unsere gemeinsame Geschäftssprache. Trotzdem arbeiten wir auch auf Deutsch und sind umgeben von vielen weiteren Sprachen. Das Team von JUNIQE kommt aus mehr als 17 Ländern und bringt enormen Erfahrungsschatz und Leidenschaft für seine Arbeit mit. Wir inspirieren, unterstützen und fordern uns gegenseitig, während wir wachsen und lernen.

Unser lichtdurchflutetes und kreativ gestaltetes Büro bietet viel Platz für eine inspirierende Arbeitsatmosphäre. Ob voller Fokus in einem unserer Meetingräume oder Entspannung bei der Pause in unserer bunten Küche.

WARUM DU MIT UNS ARBEITEN SOLLTEST?


 * Technische Entscheidungen treffen wir im Team: Deine Ideen zählen, Deine Lösungen werden gehört – hier kannst Du Verantwortung übernehmen und aktiv mitgestalten
 * Dein Code hat bei uns echte Wirkung - von der ersten Codezeile bis zum fertigen Produkt schreibst Du bei uns Software, die man anfassen kann
 * Wir setzen auf neueste Technologien und Tools - für zukunftssichere Entwicklung und Spaß am Coden
 * Wir haben Spaß bei der Arbeit im modernen Office in bester Lage und bei uns geht’s immer mit Anspruch Vollgas zur Sache!
 * Du bist Teil eines Teams aus sympathischen und erfahrenen Softwareentwicklern
 * Wir haben flache Hierarchien, legen Wert auf direkte Kommunikation und treffen schnell Entscheidungen
 * Wir sind ein profitables Familienunternehmen und unabhängig von Investoren
 * Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche und Quartalsziele für Deine Entwicklung
 * Wir wollen, dass Du Dich weiterbildest: Such Dir aus, welche Konferenzen Du besuchen oder welche Weiterbildungen Du machen willst
 * Regelmäßige Meetups in unserer Reihe mit spannenden Speakern und Entwicklern
 * Jede Menge coole Team-Events wie Sommerfest, Casino Night und Pub Quiz oder einfach mal spontan mit den Kollegen grillen
 * Hol Dir den Fitness- oder Wellness-Boost! Mit unserem EGYM WELLPASS hast Du Zugang zu den besten Fitnessstudios und Wellnessangeboten bei Dir um die Ecke
 * Bleib mobil mit JobRad oder unserem super günstigen (E-)MINI-Leasing-Programm
 * Satte Freibeträge gibt’s auf alle JUNIQE Produkte und attraktive Mitarbeitervorteile bei unseren Partnern
 * Kaffee, Freigetränke, Bierkühlschrank und frisches Obst für alle

job_description:
JOB DESCRIPTION


Welcome to Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering and R&D projects. As a consulting and services company, we help the world's most innovative companies realise their full potential: From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, we think outside the box across a wide range of industries.

We are looking for you to join our Software Engineering team to develop breakthrough products and platforms using leading software technologies! Implement embedded software in physical products (e.g. ECUs for autonomous driving), design the lifecycle of customer-facing.

Join us and take the opportunity to shape your career at Capgemini Engineering and experience every working day with enthusiasm!



YOUR TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES WITH US:

 * You develop safety requirements and architectural design for customers.
 * You perform Safety Analysis and Dependent Safety Analysis to identify potential safety gaps and define mitigation measures.
 * You are responsible for the technical coordination and management of safety work products within the team.
 * You are responsible for the technical coordination and management of safety work products with external stakeholders.
 * You ensure compliance with safety standards (ISO 26262, SOTIF, etc.).

YOU CONVINCE US WITH

 * Your completed degree in Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Automotive Technology, Computer Science or a comparable field of study.
 * Your extensive experience with Automotive Functional Safety standard ISO 26262, mainly in the following parts: Part 4, Part 5, Part 6, Part 8 and Part 9.

job_description_html:
Job Description


Welcome to Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering and R&D projects. As a consulting and services company, we help the world's most innovative companies realise their full potential: From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, we think outside the box across a wide range of industries.

We are looking for you to join our Software Engineering team to develop breakthrough products and platforms using leading software technologies! Implement embedded software in physical products (e.g. ECUs for autonomous driving), design the lifecycle of customer-facing.

Join us and take the opportunity to shape your career at Capgemini Engineering and experience every working day with enthusiasm!

YOUR TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES WITH US:

  • You develop safety requirements and architectural design for customers.
  • You perform Safety Analysis and Dependent Safety Analysis to identify potential safety gaps and define mitigation measures.
  • You are responsible for the technical coordination and management of safety work products within the team.
  • You are responsible for the technical coordination and management of safety work products with external stakeholders.
  • You ensure compliance with safety standards (ISO 26262, SOTIF, etc.).

YOU CONVINCE US WITH

  • Your completed degree in Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Automotive Technology, Computer Science or a comparable field of study.
  • Your extensive experience with Automotive Functional Safety standard ISO 26262, mainly in the following parts: Part 4, Part 5, Part 6, Part 8 and Part 9.
  • Your extensive experience in defining Software Safety Requirements Specification based on the Technical Safety Requirements allocated to software and the Assumptions of Use defined in the safety manuals of SEooCs.
  • Your extensive experience defining Software Architectural Design based on the Software Safety Requirements Specification.
  • Your motivation, self-driven attitude, systematic approach, good communication skills, and team spirit.
  • You have excellent communication skills: English C1 or equivalent and German B2 or equivalent.

Not a 100% match? No need to worry! Capgemini Engineering supports you with a wide range of learning opportunities so that you can develop both professionally and personally.

job_title: Middle level Back-end (Go) Engineer (m/f/d) - Content Platform team
job_description:
The Content Platform team is looking for a motivated and driven Back-end (Go) engineer who will help us shape our team, drive the company to the next level, and have the most direct influence on our success.

The team works closely with eCommerce, Marketing, and Customer Service to provide ideal entry points into Flix’s customer-facing web properties. We develop the business's homepage, Content Management System (CMS), demand-driven search engine landing pages, and an interactive map that allows users to explore Flix’s destinations.

Working with us means you’ll be building the very first touchpoint most customers have with Flix, be it a direct visit to the homepage or a city-related landing page reached through a Google search. Your releases will be viewed and interacted with by a very large audience.

You’ll be joining an open-minded and easy-going team that currently consists of 4 Software Engineers and a UI/UX Expert. Our tech stack mainly consists of:

 * Backend: Go, ArangoDB, MySQL, Confluent Kafka, Snowflake, GraphQL + different AWS services
 * Frontend: server-side rendered HTML + JavaScript, Typescript, React

Your Tasks – Paint the world green

 * As part of the cross-functional, self-organised team, you work iteratively on implementing sustainable solutions that deliver business value and are backed by a well-designed implementation that is easy to change, self-documenting, and well-tested.
 * You are responsible for developing, building, and maintaining our Homepage, Automated Landing Pages, and Exploration Map for all Flix markets.
 * A strong team player with expertise in Agile methodologies, valuing close collaboration, shared responsibilities, and iterative development.
 * As part of your daily work, you work closely with your fellow team members, for example in pair and mob programming, doing code reviews and testing.
 * You analyse, propose, and drive technology improvements.
 * You proactively seek to learn new technologies and gain a deeper insight into the business domain.
 * You enjoy sharing your expertise and helping both within your team and outside of it.
 * You support our agile, flexible, team-oriented development.

Your Profile – Ready to hop on board

 * At least 4 years of hands-on software engineering experience, including a solid practical experience using Go
 * Skills in building high-performant, scalable, and reliable large-scale applications
 * Experience working with different types of databases (relational, NoSQL)
 * Knowledge of distributed architecture and API design (GraphQL, REST API)
 * Experience working with Docker and Kubernetes
 * Experience in CI/CD
 * Familiar with cloud technologies, including AWS
 * Experience in unit & integration testing

Nice to have

 * IaC (Terraform)
 * Experience working with Kafka
 * Some experience with PHP and JavaScript

Our Perks – More than just a job

 * You have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are creating the easiest way to travel. We want your ideas and give you autonomy to make them reality.
 * Flix is flexible. Organize your own schedule with trust-based hours and up to 60 days of working from (m)anywhere. We are an office-first company, and we encourage all employees to come regularly to their local office.
 * Travelling is our passion. Discover the world with your free Flix rides and bring along your friends and family for half price.
 * Teamwork makes the dream work. Our FlixTeam has people from over 80 different nations. We work in a multicultural environment where we can challenge and support each other.
 * We're not only green in color. We’re building for the long term, and that means protecting our planet. We constantly test new green technologies and compensate for the CO2 after all our business travel since 2018.
 * Your well-being is important to us. To treat your mind and body we will give you a competitive paid time off package, mental health support including 1:1 consultations with a psychologist, and a neat discount on UrbanSportsClub memberships.

Want to rewrite the history of mobility with us? Then join our ride and apply now. We're excited to hear from you! We recognize that everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences. If you think you could have an impact even though you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply.



Flix – A place to enjoy work and have an impact

The future of transportation is Green. Here at Flix Tech, the R&D group, we develop software with the brightest minds from around the world to engineer new experiences for our millions of customers across our apps and websites. Every day we solve challenging problems, like how to scale rapidly around the world and how to make an experience that delights our customers. We have a culture of sharing ideas, contributing to open source projects and being an active member in our technical communities.

Flix is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy and gender identity), national, social or ethnic origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, competence and merit.

employerBenefitSummary.comment:
Let's make our journey together the best it can possibly be. With benefits that not only make you enjoy life (and work) more but treat your mind and body well.

  • Flexible working hours and up to 60 days of working from (m)anywhere.
  • Free personal rides for employees + 50% friends and family discount
  • International teams with more than 90 nationalities
  • Well-being offers (1:1 counselling with OpenUp, + gym memberships)
  • Language learning support with Babbel and Learnlight
  • Sustainable company, compensating for all business travel related CO2

managedContent.body:
What a journey!

When they founded Flix in 2013, entrepreneurs Jochen Engert, André Schwämmlein and Daniel Krauss planned to make bus travel sustainable, comfortable and affordable. FlixBus started with buses on the German road and quickly became market leader across Europe, developing into the largest range of long-distance buses on the continent. Flix is now operating in over 40 countries as well as the USA and South America. There is an international team of over 3,000 employees working from over 20 locations with headquarters in Munich and Berlin.
managedContent.title: Flix's Story

managedContent.body:
Painting the world green


Our vision is to make it possible for everyone to discover the world to enjoy smart, sustainable travel. Ease of booking and an ever-growing offering mean that we provide millions of travelers with a comfortable, affordable, eco-friendly travel experience. Our green long-distance buses and long-distance trains meet the highest standards of comfort, safety and environmental protection, and offer a green alternative to private transport.
managedContent.title: Our vision

managedContent.body:
We move limits – on maps and in minds
Flix isn’t just any company. We move limits constantly, because we believe that what we do matters to millions of people. The way we do it is equally important – and this includes the behaviors and mindsets that we value in ourselves and in each other.

Our team in numbers


When you're working at Flix you're working with the whole world. Not literally of course, at least not yet. Nevertheless, we grew from just a few people in a tiny office to a FlixTeam of thousands of people. And the more we grow, the more international we become, because we love to work across locations and nationalities so we can meet and get to know diverse cultures and viewpoints. Just like travelling...
managedContent.title: Working at Flix

managedContent.body:
We have developed our values, the Flix4, together, listening to employees and leaders alike, to make sure we are creating a culture where everyone can thrive and be included. The Flix 4, as we call it, summarize what working at Flix is all about – clustered in four different dimensions.

We build for generations
Every day, because we want to impact our communities and the greater world with building a sustainable future.

We push boundaries
and chase new ideas since day one.

We win together
when we work together, as teams.

I make an impact
underlines how each of us at Flix can make us a high-impact organization.
managedContent.title: Values - Our Flix4

job_title: Middle level Golang Engineer (m/f/d) - Content Platform team
job_description:
The Content Platform team is looking for a motivated and driven Golang engineer who will help us shape our team, drive the company to the next level, and have the most direct influence on our success.

The team works closely with eCommerce, Marketing, and Customer Service to provide ideal entry points into Flix's customer-facing web properties. We develop the business's homepage, Content Management System (CMS), demand-driven search engine landing pages, and an interactive map that allows users to explore Flix's destinations.

Working with us means you'll be building the very first touchpoint most customers have with Flix, be it a direct visit to the homepage or a city-related landing page reached through a Google search. Your releases will be viewed and interacted with by a very large audience.

You'll be joining an open-minded and easy-going team that currently consists of 4 Software Engineers and a UI/UX Expert. Our tech stack mainly consists of:

 * Backend: Go, ArangoDB, MySQL, Confluent Kafka, Snowflake, GraphQL + different AWS services
 * Frontend: server-side rendered HTML + JavaScript, Typescript, React


YOUR TASKS – PAINT THE WORLD GREEN

 * As part of the cross-functional, self-organised team, you work iteratively on implementing sustainable solutions that deliver business value and are backed by a well-designed implementation that is easy to change, self-documenting, and well-tested.
 * You are responsible for developing, building, and maintaining our Homepage, Automated Landing Pages, and Exploration Map for all Flix markets.
 * A strong team player with expertise in Agile methodologies, valuing close collaboration, shared responsibilities, and iterative development.
 * As part of your daily work, you work closely with your fellow team members, for example in pair and mob programming, doing code reviews and testing.
 * You analyse, propose, and drive technology improvements.
 * You proactively seek to learn new technologies and gain a deeper insight into the business domain.
 * You enjoy sharing your expertise and helping both within your team and outside of it.
 * You support our agile, flexible, team-oriented development.


YOUR PROFILE – READY TO HOP ON BOARD

 * At least 4 years of hands-on software engineering experience, including a solid practical experience using Go
 * Skills in building high-performant, scalable, and reliable large-scale applications
 * Experience working with different types of databases (relational, NoSQL)
 * Knowledge of distributed architecture and API design (GraphQL, REST API)
 * Experience working with Docker and Kubernetes
 * Experience in CI/CD
 * Familiar with cloud technologies, including AWS
 * Experience in unit & integration testing

Nice to have

 * IaC (Terraform)
 * Experience working with Kafka
 * Some experience with PHP and JavaScript


OUR PERKS – MORE THAN JUST A JOB

 * You have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are creating the easiest way to travel. We want your ideas and give you autonomy to make them reality.
 * Flix is flexible. Organize your own schedule with trust-based hours and up to 60 days of working from (m)anywhere. We are an office-first company, and we encourage all employees to come regularly to their local office.
 * Travelling is our passion. Discover the world with your free Flix rides and bring along your friends and family for half price.
 * Teamwork makes the dream work. Our FlixTeam has people from over 80 different nations. We work in a multicultural environment where we can challenge and support each other.
 * We're not only green in color. We're building for the long term, and that means protecting our planet. We constantly test new green technologies and compensate for the CO2 after all our business travel since 2018.
 * Your well-being is important to us. To treat your mind and body we will give you a competitive paid time off package, mental health support including 1:1 consultations with a psychologist, and a neat discount on UrbanSportsClub memberships.

Want to rewrite the history of mobility with us? Then join our ride and apply now. We're excited to hear from you! We recognize that everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences. If you think you could have an impact even though you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply.



Flix – A place to enjoy work and have an impact

The future of transportation is Green. Here at Flix Tech, the R&D group, we develop software with the brightest minds from around the world to engineer new experiences for our millions of customers across our apps and websites. Every day we solve challenging problems, like how to scale rapidly around the world and how to make an experience that delights our customers. We have a culture of sharing ideas, contributing to open source projects and being an active member in our technical communities.

Flix is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy and gender identity), national, social or ethnic origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, competence and merit.

job.jobTitleText: Middle level Golang Engineer (m/f/d) - Content Platform team

job_description:
G+D macht das Leben von Milliarden von Menschen weltweit sicherer. Wir schaffen Vertrauen im digitalen Zeitalter, mit integrierten Sicherheitstechnologien in drei Geschäftsbereichen: Digital Security, Financial Platforms und Currency Technology. Für unsere Kunden sind wir seit über 170 Jahren ein verlässlicher Partner mit unseren innovativen Lösungen für SecurityTech! Wir sind ein internationaler Technologiekonzern und traditionelles Familienunternehmen mit über 14.000 Beschäftigten in 40 Ländern. Creating Confidence ist dabei unser Weg zum Erfolg. Vertrauen ist die Basis unserer Zusammenarbeit innerhalb von G+D.

Die ganze Welt vertraut uns, wenn es um physische oder digitale Währungen geht. Wir steigern die Sicherheit und Effizienz im Bargeldkreislauf in Zusammenarbeit mit den Zentralbanken und der gesamten Währungsindustrie. Wollen Sie mit uns, als Marktführer im Bereich Advanced Currency Management, die Zukunft des Bezahlens gemeinsam gestalten?

Als Innovator und Marktführer bei G+D Currency Technology entwickeln wir hochmoderne Systeme und Lösungen zur Banknotenbearbeitung und investieren in die Automatisierung und Digitalisierung unserer Geschäftsfelder. Über diesen Link kannst Du Dir einen ersten Eindruck unserer Banknotenbearbeitungssysteme verschaffen. Wir entwickeln dabei Softwareprodukte und -lösungen von Embedded bis Cloud. Zur Stärkung der Software-Qualitätssicherung, Testautomatisierung und Cyber-Security suchen wir Dich als Software Quality Assurance Lead (m/w/d), um diese Themen gezielt voranzutreiben.


DEINE AUFGABEN:

 * Als Vorbild und Leader berätst und unterstützt Du unsere agilen Entwicklungsteams in allen Belangen der kontinuierlichen Software-Qualitätssicherung entlang des gesamten Entwicklungsprozesses. Dabei etablierst und entwickelst Du übergreifende Best Practices und Standards weiter.
 * Du verantwortest die Strategie zur Testautomatisierung, erstellst die Roadmap und setzt diese gemeinsam mit unseren Testautomation Engineers in den agilen Teams um.
 * Du entwickelst unsere Testinfrastruktur, Testframeworks sowie eingesetzte Technologien und Tools kontinuierlich weiter. Dabei berücksichtigst Du aktuelle Trends, um beispielsweise die Testausführungszeiten zu reduzieren oder durch den Einsatz von KI die Test-Effektivität und -Effizienz zu erhöhen.
 * Du coachst und entwickelst die Fähigkeiten unserer Entwicklungsteams in allen Aspekten der Software-Qualitätssicherung und Testautomatisierung weiter. Dazu gehören Teststrategien und -methoden, Automatisierung von Abläufen, Built-in Quality, A/TDD, Continuous Testing im CI-Context, Test-Impact-Analyse oder auch der Secure-SDLC. Du prägst damit eine entsprechende Qualitätskultur in den Teams.
 * Du stellst die Einhaltung von Qualitätsstandards, Regularien und des Secure-SDLC sicher.
 * Du nutzt verschiedene Metriken, um gemeinsam mit den Teams die SW-Produktqualität sicherzustellen, Verbesserungsmaßnahmen im Software-Entstehungsprozess zu identifizieren und umzusetzen.


DEIN PROFIL:

 * Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder vergleichbare Ausbildung
 * Tiefgreifende Erfahrung in der Software-Qualitätssicherung im Zusammenhang mit selbstverantwortlichen, agilen Teams•Nachgewiesene Fähigkeit, Teams zu leiten und zu coachen, sowie eine Vorbildfunktion einzunehmen
 * Fundierte Expertise in Testautomatisierung, Testinfrastruktur, Testframeworks und den neuesten Technologien wie bspw. KI und Tools
 * Starke analytische Fähigkeiten zur Identifizierung und Umsetzung von Verbesserungsmaßnahmen im Software-Entstehungsprozess
 * Erfahrung in der Implementierung und Sicherstellung von Secure Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
 * Leidenschaft für qualitativ gute Softwareentwicklung, Technologie und Innovation
 * Hervorragende Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch, um effektiv mit verschiedenen Stakeholdern zusammenzuarbeiten und eine Qualitätskultur in den Teams und im Zusammenspiel der Teams zu fördern


DEINE BENEFITS:

 * Eine spannende Position in einem einzigartigen Business mit internationalem Umfeld
 * Vielfältige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten zur Unterstützung Deiner Karriere bei uns
 * Flexible Arbeitszeiten und davon in Teilen natürlich die Möglichkeit auf Remotearbeit
 * Ein wettbewerbsfähiges Gehalt und eine arbeitgeberfinanzierte betriebliche Altersversorgung
 * Du profitierst von einer gelebten Work-Life-Balance, attraktiven Familienleistungen und einem vielfältigen betrieblichen Gesundheitsmanagement


WAS WIR IHNEN BIETEN


A LOOK BEHIND THE SCENES





KONTAKT



Sabrina Edelmann


career@gi-de.com










JOB DETAILS

Wir sind ein Unternehmen mit chancengerechter Unternehmenskultur! Wir schätzen Vielfalt in all ihren Formen und schaffen ein inklusives Arbeitsumfeld, das frei von Vorurteilen, Diskriminierung und Belästigung ist und in dem sich alle Beschäftigten zugehörig fühlen. Wir begrüßen alle Bewerbungen, unabhängig von Geschlecht, Alter, ethnischer Herkunft, sozialem und kulturellem Hintergrund, Religion, Behinderung oder sexueller Orientierung.

Dabei berücksichtigst Du aktuelle Trends, um beispielsweise die Testausführungszeiten zu reduzieren oder durch den Einsatz von KI die Test-Effektivität und -Effizienz zu erhöhen.
  • Du coachst und entwickelst die Fähigkeiten unserer Entwicklungsteams in allen Aspekten der Software-Qualitätssicherung und Testautomatisierung weiter. Dazu gehören Teststrategien und -methoden, Automatisierung von Abläufen, Built-in Quality, A/TDD, Continuous Testing im CI-Context, Test-Impact-Analyse oder auch der Secure-SDLC. Du prägst damit eine entsprechende Qualitätskultur in den Teams.
  • Du stellst die Einhaltung von Qualitätsstandards, Regularien und des Secure-SDLC sicher.
  • Du nutzt verschiedene Metriken, um gemeinsam mit den Teams die SW-Produktqualität sicherzustellen, Verbesserungsmaßnahmen im Software-Entstehungsprozess zu identifizieren und umzusetzen.

Dein Profil:

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder vergleichbare Ausbildung
  • Tiefgreifende Erfahrung in der Software-Qualitätssicherung im Zusammenhang mit selbstverantwortlichen, agilen Teams•Nachgewiesene Fähigkeit, Teams zu leiten und zu coachen, sowie eine Vorbildfunktion einzunehmen
  • Fundierte Expertise in Testautomatisierung, Testinfrastruktur, Testframeworks und den neuesten Technologien wie bspw. KI und Tools
  • Starke analytische Fähigkeiten zur Identifizierung und Umsetzung von Verbesserungsmaßnahmen im Software-Entstehungsprozess
  • Erfahrung in der Implementierung und Sicherstellung von Secure Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
  • Leidenschaft für qualitativ gute Softwareentwicklung, Technologie und Innovation
  • Hervorragende Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch, um effektiv mit verschiedenen Stakeholdern zusammenzuarbeiten und eine Qualitätskultur in den Teams und im Zusammenspiel der Teams zu fördern

Deine Benefits:

  • Eine spannende Position in einem einzigartigen Business mit internationalem Umfeld
  • Vielfältige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten zur Unterstützung Deiner Karriere bei uns
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten und davon in Teilen natürlich die Möglichkeit auf Remotearbeit
  • Ein wettbewerbsfähiges Gehalt und eine arbeitgeberfinanzierte betriebliche Altersversorgung
  • Du profitierst von einer gelebten Work-Life-Balance, attraktiven Familienleistungen und einem vielfältigen betrieblichen Gesundheitsmanagement

job_description:
Java Developer (m/w/d)

Location: München




Employment Type: Fulltime Hybrid
Language skills: German is a must
Experience: 2 - 7 years

As Software Engineer with a backend focus, you implementand plan new functionalities for our platform in close collaboration with yourteam and our radiologists. You plan the technical roadmap together with yourteam and the CTO, evaluate technologies and methodologies, and drive anengineering culture of quality and innovation. Your focus is on the backendcomponents, including APIs, services and databases.

OUR TECH STACK

 * We are just at the beginning, this is what we currently use:

FRONTEND

 * React
 * MUI
 * For the moment we use ReactAdmin a lot

BACKEND

 * Java for the moment, Kotlin soon
 * Spring
 * Microservices

INFRASTRUCTURE

 * Kubernetes
 * Helm
 * Terraform
 * OpenStack
 * GitLab for CI/CD and issues

WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU

 * Strong software development experience using Java or Kotlin (2 years +)
 * Experience using Spring Boot in a microservice environment
 * Track record of working in an agile setup using continuous deployment and delivery
 * Experience with containerization and container orchestration (Docker and Kubernetespreferred)
 * You fall in love with both: the product and the technologies used to create it

job_title: Senior Software Engineer, C++ and Qt
job_description:
NVIDIA's products, hardware and software, are world leaders for performance and efficiency. We are continually innovating in creative ways to improve our ability to deliver outstanding solutions across a wide range of sectors. We are seeking System Software Engineers who are passionate about what they do and are committed to making a difference in the world through their inventions. In the Software Developer Tools Team, we enable 1st & 3rd-party developers to turn NVIDIA's hardware into groundbreaking cluster, server, professional, consumer, automotive, and embedded solutions.



What you will be doing:

 * Join the Developer Tools team to work on software such as Nsight Systems.

 * Work with a wide variety of hardware platforms, ranging from small embedded systems, to large multi-GPU and NUMA servers and clusters.

 * Design and implement product features in C++ and using Qt Widgets that would help visualize and explain the performance data.

 * Help migrate parts of the existing C++ user interfaces towards a client-server architecture, and a modern frontend development stack with TypeScript and React.

 * Improve tests, from small unit tests all the way to comprehensive UI tests. Work with QA engineers to develop a test plan for the new features.

 * Communicate across multiple teams to collect and understand the requirements. Understand how the underlying hardware and software works, and use that knowledge to deliver valuable features to the users. Participate in all phases of the software life cycle.

 * Collaborate with team members across multiple time zones in a dynamic, high-energy work environment.

 * Interact with internal and external users, help them get the maximum value out of our products, and deliver their feedback to the product team.



What we need to see:

 * Excellent problem solving, collaborative, and interpersonal skills.

 * Strong C++ knowledge, experience working with concurrent code.

 * Experience with Qt Widgets.

 * Strong grasp of algorithms and computer architecture.

 * BS or MS in EE, CE, CS, Systems Engineering and 4 years of experience in a related software position.



Ways to stand out from the crowd:

 * Background in developing user interfaces, driving them from mockups through product design reviews and to completion.

 * Experience with GPUs, CUDA, HPC, clusters, networking, and distributed environments.

 * Experience with Python.



With competitive salaries and a generous benefits package, NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. Our diverse team of talented, capable, and professional people is our greatest asset! If you're a creative and autonomous engineer with a real passion for technology, we want to hear from you!



NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.
